intro: Austrochthamalia teyucuarensis, commonly known as the Teyucuarensis thornbush, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Argentina. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with woody stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the dry season. It is well adapted to harsh, semi-arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
